tweet: As the proud representative of Ventura County’s U.S. Coast Guard stations, I will continue to work to ensure our Coasties have the resources they need to support their critical missions.

Wednesday @TransportDems passed the “Pay Our Coast Guard Parity Act” to ensure that our Coast Guard members will never again go without pay in the event of a government shutdown. pic.twitter.com/A74eQtr7Ec

Today, we celebrate the life of #CesarChavez, a remarkable man defined by his faith, humility, and dedication to social justice.

Hoy, celebramos la vida de César Chávez, un hombre extraordinario y definido por su fe, humildad y dedicación a la justicia social.

#CesarChavezDay pic.twitter.com/hHm1CJJxVh

At this week’s @TransportDems hearing, we passed legislation to help speed up the recovery process for communities affected by natural disasters and improve accountability in federal disaster programs to ensure taxpayers’ money is spent appropriately. pic.twitter.com/kvFE8R2bkQ
Congratulations to Ventura County for being ranked in the top 10 of healthy counties in California by @RWJF! https://twitter.com/CHRankings/status/1107985079945609218 …

This week, I visited Washington DC VA Medical Center and met with veterans and physicians who care for our veterans. As Chairwoman of @VetAffairsDems Health Subcommittee, ensuring that vets have access to high-quality care in a safe and welcoming environment is a top priority.

#TitleX family planning funds help 4 million low-income people afford basic healthcare services. In another attack on women, the Trump admin just announced $ for a chain of so-called women’s clinics that refuse to provide birth control. This is down-right dangerous and offensive.

Thank you to everyone who attended my office’s Tax Assistance Workshop over the weekend! If your income is less than $55,000 per year and you still need assistance with your taxes, please contact my office at (805) 379-1779. pic.twitter.com/GnCkziqWbq

Trump officially initiated move to divert military personnel funds to build his wall. He’s also threatened to cut construction that could include critical projects at @NBVCCalifornia. This unconstitutional power grab will hurt military readiness. I will keep fighting to stop it. https://twitter.com/CNN/status/1110350236927643649 …

On National Vietnam War Veterans Day, we pay tribute to all the heroes who served & honor the 58,000+ who lost their lives, including 106 servicemembers from #CA26. They made the ultimate sacrifice to protect our values, our security & our way of life — & we'll never forget them. pic.twitter.com/7lBKI6Hlqw

So many women veterans have been overlooked for far too long. I’m proud to be original co-sponsor of Hello Girls Congressional Gold Medal Act, which would honor trailblazing female telephone operators of the Army Signal Corps & contributions they made for our country during WWI. pic.twitter.com/UaL0FBviwK

Those who have served our country deserve every possible effective treatment to address wounds of war.

I intro-ed bill today to expand evidence-based complementary & integrative medicine at VA to reduce dependence on opioids & better treat PTSD, chronic pain & other conditions. pic.twitter.com/8MhMSEKptM

Today, I was proud to vote against the President’s discriminatory ban on transgender servicemembers serving in our nation’s military. We must #ProtectTransTroops and ensure that every American who is able can serve openly and with dignity.

I stand in support of my transgender constituents and transgender people across the nation because everyone deserves to live a life safe and free from discrimination. #TransVisibilityWeek pic.twitter.com/ZDD18uAfSY

While we are on the road to rebuilding, our community is still recovering from last year’s devastating #WoolseyFire and #HillFire. Proud to join my colleagues today to introduce #HR9, @HouseDemocrats bill to keep America in the Paris Agreement and take #ClimateActionNow. Yesterday, Trump admin announced it (again) wants to repeal #ACA & rip health coverage from millions.
 
Today, House Dems follow through on promise to strengthen protections for preexisting conditions, lower premiums, make care more accessible.
 
You tell me who’s #ForThePeople.

Leader McConnell, I don’t know if you’ve heard, but the House voted 420-0 to release the Mueller report. It’s time to give the American people the full transparency they deserve.
#ReleaseTheReport https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1110297581614231553 …

Nine years ago today, the #ACA was signed in to law. While there is more we must do to ensure that all Americans have access to quality, affordable healthcare, it is clear that this legislation saved the lives of many Americans, including right here in Ventura County.

Now that former FBI Director Mueller’s investigation has concluded, I urge Attorney General Barr to make the full report available for the American people to review. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1109199357491007489 …

Proud to serve as a member of the largest @LGBTEqCaucus in the history of the U.S. House of Representatives! Places of worship should be sanctuaries, where all are welcome and feel safe. Together, we must reject hatred and bigotry in all of its insidious forms.
I am saddened and horrified by news of the massacres in New Zealand. My heart is with the loved ones of those who were lost and everyone who was impacted by this unspeakable tragedy.

I am proud to support the EACH Woman Act to ensure that every woman, no matter where she lives or what her income is, has access to a full range of reproductive health care services. #4EACHofUs #BeBoldEndHyde pic.twitter.com/YSvO07Ghod

Dreamers are essential members of communities across the country, including right here in Ventura County. I introduced two bills yesterday to ensure that the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs has the resources it needs to care for America’s heroes.  https://juliabrownley.house.gov/brownley-introduces-two-bills-to-fix-va-funding-process-ensure-veterans-get-care-they-need/ … pic.twitter.com/nsm6kJNfss

Unfortunately, the #TrumpBudget prioritizes:
❌ Clawing back funds for vets' healthcare infrastructure 
❌ Ransacking Medicare and Medicaid 
❌ Cutting higher education funding

As Chairwoman of the House Veterans’ Affairs Health Subcommittee, I will fight to ensure that we address this issue with the urgency that it deserves because one life lost to suicide is one too many.

Recently, @VetAffairsDems held a roundtable and hearings with @DeptVetAffairs, @VFWHQ, and other Veteran Service Organizations to discuss important issues facing veterans around the country, including ways in which we can better address the devastating veteran suicide epidemic. pic.twitter.com/xMBLL9PgD7
We must never forget those who perished, the heroes who saved lives that day, and the critical importance of our infrastructure.

The bill I co-authored with @RepKatieHill, @SenKamalaHarris & @SenFeinstein to establish memorial to honor lives lost in the St. Francis Dam collapse, the second deadliest catastrophe in CA history, has officially been signed into law — exactly 91 years after this tragic event. https://twitter.com/Sammy_Roth/status/1105560886444351488 …

For over 100 years, @GirlScouts has given girls, including my daughter Hannah, the tools to lead, break barriers, and create positive change. Join me in celebrating Girl Scouts’ birthday with the girls who dream big and do bigger! #ThinkOutsideTheCookieBox pic.twitter.com/3zGrvI2KJK

Last year, @StateDept erased #ReproRights from annual Human Rights Reports & they could do so again. That's why I joined 158 of my colleagues to introduce #ReproRightsAreHumanRightsAct to resume critical reporting on #ReproRights & keep women’s rights at the forefront. pic.twitter.com/Dz0q968eeX

#VAWA has provided critical support for countless survivors of domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault & stalking. Congress needs to immediately reauthorize #VAWA19 so that we can continue to fund these critical services that save lives & empower survivors. #VAWA4ALL

I am especially pleased that this legislation includes two bills I authored to end partisan gerrymandering and fix the redistricting process. In Congress, I will continue to work to return our government to one that is of, by, and for the people once again.

Today, the House passed #HR1 — a major win for our democracy & for the American people. We are one step closer to passing transformative legislation to fight special interests, take money out of politics & finally put the power of our democracy back in the hands of the people.

I met w/ Stephanie Wiggins, new CEO of @Metrolink, to discuss this important part of Ventura County’s transportation system. As a member of @TransportDems, I'll continue to work diligently to secure funds for local transportation initiatives that keep our community safe & moving. pic.twitter.com/qT2a1lqPuV

My favorite 3 words in our Constitution are the first 3 words: #WeThePeople.

The will of the public is the basis of our entire democracy.
 
But for far too long, special interests have rigged the system against everyday Americans.

That changes with #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act. pic.twitter.com/es5RyAVLeT

On this day in 1980, Channel Islands National Park officially became America’s 40th national park. We are so lucky to have this gem right in our backyard, and I will continue to fight to protect America’s beautiful lands so they can be enjoyed by future generations. pic.twitter.com/tZcWy3trPD

That is why I am proud to support the Servicemember and Veterans’ Empowerment and Support Act, which will help make reporting and seeking care for military sexual assault easier, and ensure that these survivors can get the support and care that they have earned and deserve.

It is simply unacceptable that any member of our Armed Forces has to endure sexual trauma, and our country continues to fail survivors by putting up unnecessary roadblocks for them to get the care they need. https://pingree.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/tester-murkowski-pingree-reintroduce-bill-support-survivors-military …

I am looking forward to continuing to work with members of the Caucus to ensure our military has the resources needed to support our major range and test facility bases, like @NBVCCalifornia, which play a critical role in protecting the U.S. military’s technological advantages.

I am proud to announce that @DesJarlaisTN04 and I will serve as co-chairs of the Congressional Range and Testing Center Caucus in the 116th Congress. https://juliabrownley.house.gov/brownley-and-desjarlais-announce-relaunch-of-congressional-range-and-testing-center-caucus/ …

The Congressional Award recognizes young people for achieving goals in volunteer public service, personal development, physical fitness, and expedition/exploration. I look forward to seeing where the future takes both of these terrific young people!
Recently, I had the pleasure of presenting the Congressional Award’s Gold Medal to Mark Hanson of Oxnard and the Bronze Medal to Jacqueline Emanuel of Thousand Oaks. pic.twitter.com/lQheUfrVVn

Recently, I met with constituents from the Southwinds Neighborhood of Oxnard to discuss their concerns and to hear how we can work together to ensure our cities and neighborhoods receive the support and resources they need to thrive. pic.twitter.com/rxrogIFdYs

I will continue to work across the aisle to end the veteran homelessness crisis, ensure we continue funding important housing communities like the Ormond Beach Villas, and advance bills I’ve authored to strengthen federal programs that help homeless veterans find safe housing.

It is simply unacceptable that any veteran is living out on the street. Recently, I had the opportunity to tour the Ormond Beach Villas, a new affordable housing community designed specifically for veterans and their families in Oxnard. pic.twitter.com/EDeqPx4ytF

Protecting every American’s right to vote is critical. That is why I am supporting the Voting Rights Advancement Act, which will address the U.S. Supreme Court ruling in Shelby County v. Holder directing Congress to update the Voting Rights Act. #VRAA #RestoreTheVOTE pic.twitter.com/no10qKPmOB
